intro: Agarista ciliata, commonly known as the silky agarista, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a silvery or hairy texture. Agarista ciliata is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
